quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Atoms and Atom
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, denote, components. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which is the force that binds together protons and neutrons together and thus forms the atoms nucleus?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Strong interaction

questions.question: When a hydrogen atom loses its electron it might form which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A proton

questions.question: In physics and chemistry, which isotopes are considered stable?

options.text: Isotopes that are in a bond
Isotopes in which the number of electrons, protons and neutrons is equal
Isotopes that do not form bonds

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Isotopes that are not radioactive

questions.question: Super-heavy atoms, (or super heavy elements, often abbreviated SHE), are the elements with large atomic number (starting from 104), which occur only deep in the Earths mantle. They are very useful in the study of atoms structure and properties.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In chemistry and physics, what do we call free radicals?

options.text: Atoms not part of a molecule
Atoms with at least one unpaired electron

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Atoms with at least one unpaired electron

questions.question: In nuclear physics what is a radionuclide?

options.text: A nucleus separated from the atom by radioactive processes
Two radioactive atoms in a molecule
An atom with an unstable nucleus characterized by excess energy

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An atom with an unstable nucleus characterized by excess energy

questions.question: Which of the following components of the atom is not considered an elementary particle?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Proton

questions.question: In atomic physics what does the term magnetic moment refer to?

options.text: The moment in which an atom enters a magnetic field
A miniature slice of time in an atoms magnetic interaction with other particles
The magnetic field produced by an atom
The moment in which an atom becomes magnetized

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The magnetic field produced by an atom

questions.question: Which of the following cannot affect the energy levels of the electrons of an atom?

options.text: All of these can affect the energy levels

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these can affect the energy levels

questions.question: What does the term tornado family denote?

options.text: A family that had suffered damages caused by a tornado

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A series of tornadoes

questions.question: In atomic physics, which atoms are called exotic atoms?

options.text: Atoms that occur on other planets of the Solar System but not on Earth
Atoms in which a sub-atomic particle has been replaced by another particle of the same charge
Atoms that occur on Earth naturally very rarely

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Atoms in which a sub-atomic particle has been replaced by another particle of the same charge

questions.question: What does the word tornado literally mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thunderstorm

questions.question: For the purposes of their experiments how do physicists slow down atoms in order to study them better?

options.text: By bombarding them with micro particles

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: By laser cooling

questions.question: How are the orbits in which the electrons of the atom reside called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Electron shells

questions.question: How is an atom having the valance of 1 called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Monad

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Mercury and Tornado
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, mercury, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The vast majority of tornadoes in the world occur in the Tornado Alley region which is located in this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The United States

questions.question: What is Calores Montes?

options.text: a range of mountains on Mercury

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a range of mountains on Mercury

questions.question: Mercury is the densest major body in the solar system.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which of these is a common myth concerning the damages caused by a tornado to a house?

options.text: Having trees and shrubs around the house will lessen the damages.
Opening the windows will lessen the damages.
Tornadoes spare houses painted in orange.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Opening the windows will lessen the damages.

questions.question: What actress starred in the 1996 disaster movie Twister?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Helen Hunt

questions.question: What is the common shape of large single-vortex tornadoes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wedge tornadoes

questions.question: What word is commonly used to refer to the central area of the tornado?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eye

questions.question: What is the name of the scale that is used to rate the intensity of tornadoes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fujita scale

questions.question: Mercurys maximum elongation is 32.2 degrees.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What is the name of the tornado that occurred on March 18, 1925 and became the deadliest in U.S. history?

options.text: 1896 St. Louis – East St. Louis tornado

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tri-State Tornado

questions.question: When does a transit of Mercury occur?

options.text: when the planet Mercury passes between the Earth and the Sun
when the planet Mercury has an object pass between it and the Earth
when the planet Mercury reaches maximum apparent distance from the Sun

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: when the planet Mercury passes between the Earth and the Sun

questions.question: The horse of what fictional hero is called Tornado?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zorro

questions.question: By what name was the closest planet to the Sun called by the Greeks?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hermes

questions.question: Does Mercury have an atmosphere?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: Which probe became the first probe to visit Mercury in 1974?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mariner 10

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Planet Uranus and Planet
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, field, mercury. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Does Mercury have a magnetic field?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: Uranus was renamed Urectum in what animated TV Series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Futurama

questions.question: What important advantage does algal fuel possess?

options.text: It produces much more energy than second-generation biofuel crops.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Kelp ash is used in the production of which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Glass

questions.question: Which is the largest of Uranus moons?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Titania.

questions.question: Uranus has only 10 moons.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What is the name of the Japanese dried seaweed sheets used in the preparation of sushi?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nori

questions.question: Why will worms not live in seaweed fertilizer?

options.text: Because it contains antibiotics that repulse them
Because of its high salt content

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Because of its high salt content

questions.question: How many separate rings does the planet Uranus have according to observations made with the Hubble Space Telescope in 2005?

options.text: Uranus does not have any rings.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 13 rings

questions.question: What element comprises the bulk of Uranus atmosphere?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hydrogen

questions.question: How many years does it take for the planet Uranus to orbit the Sun once?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 84

questions.question: Name the 1962 film about the planet Uranus?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Journey to the Seventh Planet

questions.question: What is the name of the first spacecraft to study the planet Uranus?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Voyager 2

questions.question: What is Mercurys spin-orbit resonance?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 3:2

questions.question: What is the planet Uranus named after?

options.text: The Egyptian god of the sky
The Roman god of the sky
The Greek god of the sky
The Babylonian god of the sky

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Greek god of the sky

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Charles Darwin and Charles Darwins
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, condition, algae. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who was Charles Darwins second son and fifth child, who became a prominent astronomer and mathematician?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Howard Darwin

questions.question: Charles Darwin was neglecting his studies at the University of Edinburgh, so his father sent him to Cambridge to get a Bachelor of Art degree, as the first step towards what profession?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Priest

questions.question: What name is commonly used to refer to the edible seaweed Caulerpa lentillifera, also known as sea grapes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Green caviar

questions.question: What medical condition is the chlorella algae beneficial for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What was Charles Darwin disgusted with while in Brazil during the second voyage of HMS Beagle?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Slavery

questions.question: What important mineral is sea lettuce especially rich in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Iron

questions.question: Marine algae may have this effect on the human body.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Laxative effect

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about Charles Darwins wife, Emma Wedgwood?

options.text: She was two years older than Charles
She was known for her charity work
She was quick-tempered and often argued with her husband

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She was known for her charity work

questions.question: The edible seaweed Irish moss contains this essential mineral used in the prevention and treatment of goiter.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Iodine

questions.question: What process does the edible seaweed called Wakame accelerate according to studies?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Burning of fat

questions.question: Charles Darwin had a passion for this popular hobby, which was introduced to him by his cousin William Darwin Fox.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Collecting beetles

questions.question: In what country did Charles Darwin experience an earthquake, leading him to form a theory on the movements of the Earths crust?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chile

questions.question: What was the supposed reason for Charles Darwins health problems that started in 1837?

options.text: A mysterious disease that he caught during his first voyage

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Overwork

questions.question: What did Charles Darwin major in at the University of Edinburgh where he joined his older brother in October 1825?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Medicine

questions.question: Charles Darwin and his wife Emma survived the death of this child of theirs.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Depression and Type
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, people, mood. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Alchemists were in search of ‘panacea’. What is panacea?

options.text: A piece of Jesus Christ’s cross

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Remedy for all ailments

questions.question: What is the best location to exercise in order to fight depression according to studies?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Outdoors

questions.question: What mineral present in some mineral waters is used as a cure for different types of depression?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lithium

questions.question: Listening to what type of music is recommended for people who suffer from mood disorders?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Soft music

questions.question: What natural therapy works best for seasonal depression and low moods due to sleep deprivation?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bright light therapy

questions.question: Bathing in what type of water is proven to battle depression and enhance the mood?

options.text: Water with temperature close to that of the human body

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cold water

questions.question: What was the special magic power of the philosophers stone that alchemists were searching for?

options.text: It would bring them luck and happiness.
It would grant them eternal life.
It would give them unprecedented knowledge.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It would give them unprecedented knowledge.

questions.question: What fields did the science of alchemy originally combine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which of these substances and minerals is not effective in the treatment of depression?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sodium

questions.question: What impressive physical characteristic did Charles Darwin possess, which made the Bank of England use his image for the ten pound note in 2000?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Large beard

questions.question: What animals are used in the treatment of mood disorders such as depression?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What spice possesses antidepressant properties?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Saffron

questions.question: What type of food is rich in tryptophan, and therefore prevents and cures depression?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What element was usually the subject of transformation in alchemy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lead

questions.question: What type of fish contains the valuable Omega-3 fatty acids, proven to fight depression and improve overall health?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cold-water fish

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Earth and Period
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, jupiter, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Mars lower density and size gives it a mass about how much that of Earth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1/10

questions.question: What is the word ‘alchemy’ generally believed to mean literally?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The art of transformation

questions.question: The earliest evidence of animal life comes from this period.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vendian

questions.question: What was the only mass extinction in which insects were affected?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Permian/Triassic event

questions.question: If I weighed 100 pounds(45.5 Kilograms) on Earth, about how much would I weigh on Mars?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 37.7 Pounds(17.1 Kilograms)

questions.question: Mars moon Deimos orbits the closest to its planet of any moon in the Solar System.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Jupiter is the fourth brightest object in the sky.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Who is the author of the 1988 book ‘The Alchemist’?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paulo Coehlo

questions.question: Which of these orders the terrestrial planets from smallest to largest by diameter?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mercury, Mars, Venus, Earth

questions.question: What did alchemists associate the planets with?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Metals

questions.question: Early amphibians such as Icthyostega evolved during what geological period?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Devonian

questions.question: In what Asian country did one of the two main branches of alchemy originate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: China

questions.question: Until what century was alchemy considered a serious science in Europe?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 16th century

questions.question: Arthropods were the largest animals on Earth during the Silurian period (443ma-417ma).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What scientist is believed to have been the first true alchemist in Medieval Europe, as well as the most significant?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roger Bacon
